[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Struct: Errmap] [Clap Parsing Vulnerabilities] Does the #[derive(Parser)] macro properly validate all input fields, or can malicious command-line arguments bypass validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Struct: Errmap] [Default Value Override] Can environment variables or config files override the #[clap(default_value)] for output_file, potentially redirecting error maps to attacker-controlled locations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [BuildConfig Mutation] Is the BuildConfig parameter passed by value or reference, and can malicious errmap execution modify shared config that affects other CLI commands? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Memory Leak] If move_model_for_package() allocates large amounts of memory for complex projects, is it properly freed, or can repeated errmap runs cause memory leaks in build servers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Stack Consumption] Does deep module nesting or large Move projects cause excessive stack usage during model building that could trigger stack overflow? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [CPU Exhaustion] Can specially crafted Move modules with complex error constant patterns cause ErrmapGen.gen() to consume excessive CPU, creating denial of service on CI/CD systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Windows Path Handling] Do path operations handle Windows-specific path formats (UNC paths, drive letters, backslashes) securely, or can this cause path traversal on Windows? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Case Sensitivity Bypass] On case-insensitive filesystems (Windows, macOS), can output_file='ErrorMap' overwrite 'errormap' unexpectedly, causing security policy bypasses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Path Separator Confusion] Can mixing forward slashes and backslashes in output_file cause unexpected behavior or bypass path validation on Windows systems? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Struct: Errmap] [Missing Input Validation] Does error_prefix validate that it contains only alphanumeric characters and underscores, or can special characters cause issues in error map generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Extension Bypass] Can output_file ending in MOVE_ERROR_DESC_EXTENSION already bypass the with_extension() logic and cause double extensions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Canonical Path Bypass] Does canonicalize() in reroot_path resolve symlinks, potentially allowing attackers to escape package boundaries through carefully placed symlinks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Information Leakage] Do generated error maps expose sensitive internal module structures, error codes, or implementation details that could aid attackers in finding vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Error Map Injection] Can malicious Move modules craft error constants with embedded null bytes or control characters that corrupt error map file format? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Map Size Explosion] Is there a limit on error map file size, or can adversaries create packages with millions of error constants to exhaust storage and cause build failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Return Value Validation] Does execute() properly signal all error conditions through anyhow::Result, or can some failure modes return Ok(()) incorrectly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Side Effect Isolation] Does execute() modify global state (environment variables, working directory) in ways that could affect other CLI commands running concurrently? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Struct: Errmap] [Field Visibility] Are error_prefix and output_file properly encapsulated, or can external code modify them after construction to bypass validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Version Mismatch] Can inconsistencies between CompilerVersion::default() and the actual Move compiler binary cause error map generation to use incompatible formats? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Language Feature Abuse] Does LanguageVersion::default() enable experimental language features that could be exploited during error constant parsing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Filter Bypass] With target_filter: None, does all_files_as_targets: true cause test files or example code with malicious errors to be included in production error maps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Scope Creep] Can all_files_as_targets: true inadvertently process files outside the package boundary if symbolic links or relative paths are present? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Logging Gaps] Are errmap generation operations logged with sufficient detail (paths, prefixes, timestamps) to detect and investigate security incidents? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/tools/move-cli/src/base/errmap.rs] [Function: execute()] [Silent Failures] Can error map generation fail silently without notifying users, potentially causing downstream tools to use stale or missing error maps? (Low)
